Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Caryophyllaceae

source.author: Adams, L.G.
source.title: Caryophyllaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Adams, L.G. (1996). Caryophyllaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Bracts, at least the upper, with scarious margins; outer sepals clearly with scarious margins almost to the base
Bracts apparently all herbaceous; 1–2 outer sepals with scarious margins obscure or absent for most of length
Bracts with scarious apices usually at least 30% of length; petals emarginate, toothed or entire, rarely prominently bifid
Bracts with scarious apices for 5–20% of length; petals bifid for at least the upper third
Petals 50% or more shorter than sepals, narrow-oblong or elliptic, sometimes rudimentary, the apex acute, often with 1–2 acute lateral teeth
Petals 10–30% shorter than sepals, narrow-obovate, the apex obtuse, usually more or less emarginate
Annual or biennial without non-flowering shoots; sepals glandular-hairy; capsule 5–8 (rarely to 10) mm long
Perennial with non-flowering shoots; sepals eglandular-hairy; capsule 9–12 mm long
Fruiting pedicels hairy but not retrorse-villous
Fruiting pedicels usually much shorter than capsules; flowers 5-merous
Fruiting pedicels equalling to much longer than capsules; flowers usually 4-merous
